txt_en: How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard.
txt_cn: 能拥有一些难以割舍的东西，这是多么幸运啊。
author: A.A. Milne

txt_en: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
txt_cn: 生活的充实与贫乏取决于一个人的勇气。
author: Anais Nin

txt_en: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody has thought.
txt_cn: 要有所发现，就要见别人见过的，想没人想过的。
author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

txt_en: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
txt_cn: 借鉴昨天，活在今天，憧憬明天。
author: Albert Einstein

txt_en: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
txt_cn: 我们永远要不够的是爱，我们永远给得不够多的也是爱。
author: Henry Valentine Miller

txt_en: I'm sure we'll meet in the spring. And catch up on everything.
txt_cn: 我们一定会在春天相见，好好聊个天。
author: Troye Sivan

txt_en: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
txt_cn: 能展现真实的自我的，与其说是我们的能力，倒不如说我们所做的选择。
author: J. K. Rowling

txt_en: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.
txt_cn: 我走得慢，但从不后退。
author: Abraham Lincoln

txt_en: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.
txt_cn: 幸福的诀窍在于能从平凡事物中提取快乐。
author: Henry Ward Beecher

txt_en: Remember to keep the mind calm in difficult moments.
txt_cn: 遇到困难时，记得保持冷静。
author: Horace

txt_en: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
txt_cn: 朋友和教养带给你的世界，是金钱所不能及的。
author: Margaret Walker

txt_en: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, and therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.
txt_cn: 爱，不是用眼睛看的，而是用心体会的，所以爱神丘比特的眼睛总是蒙着的。
author: William Shakespeare

txt_en: Curiosity is the wick in the candle of learning.
txt_cn: 如果学习是一根蜡烛，那好奇心就是烛芯。
author: William Arthur Ward

txt_en: Spend more time smiling than frowning and more time praising than criticizing.
txt_cn: 多花时间微笑，少花时间蹙眉，多花时间表扬，少花时间批评。
author: Richard Branson

txt_en: Jumping from failure to failure with undiminished enthusiasm is the big secret to success.
txt_cn: 越过一次次失败，却不丧失热情，才是成功的伟大秘诀。
author: Savas Dimopoulos

txt_en: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
txt_cn: 在每一次困境中都要寻找胜利的希望。
author: Og Mandino

txt_en: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
txt_cn: 走出舒适区，生活才算开始。
author: Neale Donald Walsch

txt_en: Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us.
txt_cn: 我们对生活的态度决定了生活对我们的态度。
author: John N. Mitchell

txt_en: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
txt_cn: 成功不是终点，失败也不足以致命，最可贵的是继续前进的勇气。
author: Winston Churchill

txt_en: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.
txt_cn: 同一棵树，在愚者和智者的眼中却有所不同。
author: William Blake

txt_en: Don't compare your life to others. You have no idea what they have been through.
txt_cn: 不要和别人比生活，你不知道他们经历了什么。
author: Sam Cawthorn

txt_en: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
txt_cn: 要对微小的事物怀有信念，因为真正的力量存乎其中。
author: Mother Teresa

txt_en: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
txt_cn: 人性中最深刻的本能就是渴望被欣赏。
author: William James

txt_en: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
txt_cn: 顽强的生命力不仅仅体现在坚持的力量，还有重新来过的能力。
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

txt_en: A heavy dew refreshed the earth at night.
txt_cn: 夜晚厚重的露水滋养着大地。
author: Leo Tolstoy

txt_en: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
txt_cn: 梦想有可能成为现实，生活正是因此而有趣。
author: Paulo Coelho

txt_en: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
txt_cn: 如果机会没有来敲门，那就自己盖个门。
author: Milton Berle

txt_en: Our growth depends not on how many experiences we devour, but on how many we digest.
txt_cn: 成长靠的不是经历有多丰富，而是对过往经历的细细品味和领会。
author: Ralph W. Sockman

txt_en: Adopting the right attitude can convert a negative stress into a positive one.
txt_cn: 采取正确的态度可以将负面的压力转化为积极的动力。
author: Hans Selye

txt_en: Try a little harder to be a little better.
txt_cn: 多做点努力，让自己变得更好一点。
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

txt_en: The older I get, the less I listen to what people say and the more I look at what they do.
txt_cn: 年龄越大，我越不会听人们嘴上怎么说，而是越会看他们怎么做。
author: Andrew Carnegie
